series.series.name: FRESH START FOR TROUPE ON 1ST AVE.

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

block.p: LEAD: Following are the highlights of Theater for the New City's Festival for Raw Space at 155 First Avenue, corner of 10th Street. All tickets are $4. Information: 254-1109.
LEAD: Following are the highlights of Theater for the New City's Festival for Raw Space at 155 First Avenue, corner of 10th Street. All tickets are $4. Information: 254-1109.
Following are the highlights of Theater for the New City's Festival for Raw Space at 155 First Avenue, corner of 10th Street. All tickets are $4. Information: 254-1109.
Tonight to Jan. 25: 8 P.M. Thunderbird American Indians' ''Pow Wow '87,'' a collection of traditional ritual dances.

Jan. 22-25: 9 P.M. Double bill of ''Time, Language, Places and the Erotic,'' by the performance artist Stuart Sherman, and ''Great Moments in Science,'' Theodora Skipitares's further adventures with Kabuki-like puppets.
Jan. 29-31: 8 P.M. Double bill featuring the performance artist Alice Farley and a cabaret act by the singer-composer Mark Hardwick.
Jan. 31: 8 P.M. Double bill featuring New York Street Theater Caravan's ''Liberty Road,'' and ''Walks of Indian Women: Aztalan to Anahuac,'' with Vira and Hortensia Colorado.
Feb. 1-18: 8 P.M. The Strawberry Opera Company presents a modern adaptation of Mozart's ''Mercy of Titus.''
Feb. 6-8: 8 P.M. Double bill featuring the Bread and Puppet Theater's ''Hunger Cantata'' and a new work by the poet-playwright H. M. Koutoukas.
Feb. 12-14: 2 P.M. ''Signal Through the Flames,'' Sheldon Rochlin's documentary about the Living Theater founders Judith Malina and Julian Beck.
Feb. 12-14: 8 P.M. The Cement Company, under the direction of George Ferencz, in ''Spaceshow,'' a multimedia extravaganza.
FRESH START FOR TROUPE ON 1ST AVE.
